_header: Worshipful and discrete that here present be
Note: Same as five stanzas of the Prologue to Chaucer’s Monk’s Tale, prefixed to 6367.
Subjects: prologues; Edward the Confessor, saint, life of
_description: ‘Prohemium’ to an extract from the Fall of Princes (1904)

CamTCC599.First Lines:
wOrship and dyscrete that here present beI wyll yow tell a tale two
                    or threAnd yef ye lyst to herkyn hedyrwardI shall yow sey the lyfe of
                    seynt Edward…
CamTCC599.Last Lines:
…Now art thow sathanas that mayst nat twynOut of mysery whyche
                    thow art in fall
